content.text: Small intestine cancer usually begins in an area of the intestine called the duodenum. This cancer is rarer than cancers in other parts of the gastrointestinal system, such as the colon and stomach. Explore the links on this page to learn more about small intestine cancer treatment, statistics, research, and clinical trials.
The information in this section is meant to help you cope with the many issues and concerns that occur when you have cancer.
Targeted Treatment for Rare Digestive Tract Cancers May Extend Survival
Drug Combination Shrinks Duodenal Polyps in People with Familial Adenomatous Polyposis
